private_information: I am allowed to move disks A, B, C, D (A is smallest, D is largest of my set).
I can perform primitive moves only for disks A, B, C, D.
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the target configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top→bottom) A; right peg has (top→bottom) B.

private_information: I am allowed to move disks E, F, G.
I can perform primitive moves only for disks E, F, G.
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the target configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top→bottom) A; right peg has (top→bottom) B.

private_information: I am allowed to move disks H, I, J (J is the largest).
I can perform primitive moves only for disks H, I, J.
agent_3.goal: Contribute to achieving the target configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top→bottom) A; right peg has (top→bottom) B.

private_information: I coordinate and integrate the agents' primitive move lists into a single valid plan.
I must produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward using the agents' moves as constraints and/or plan steps.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and problem that represent the cooperative plan for the Tower of Hanoi instance and are targeted to the FastDownward solver.

public_information: This is a standard Tower of Hanoi with three pegs named left, middle, right.
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A disk may only be placed on an empty peg or on top of a larger disk.
Agents are restricted to move only specific disks: agent_1 handles A B C D, agent_2 handles E F G, agent_3 handles H I J.
Initial configuration: left peg from top to bottom is A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J. Middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg from top to bottom C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has A; right peg has B.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can move only the disks A, B, C, D. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk-move restrictions. Do not emit PDDL. If you cannot determine some steps due to missing coordination, list only the moves you can confidently execute.
moves.prompt: Your role is agent_1. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that respects the Tower of Hanoi rules and your permission to move disks A, B, C, D. Aim to contribute to the global goal {agents->agent_1->goal}.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You can move only the disks E, F, G. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk-move restrictions. Do not emit PDDL. If you cannot determine some steps due to missing coordination, list only the moves you can confidently execute.
moves.prompt: Your role is agent_2. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that respects the Tower of Hanoi rules and your permission to move disks E, F, G. Aim to contribute to the global goal {agents->agent_2->goal}.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3. You can move only the disks H, I, J. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk-move restrictions. Do not emit PDDL. If you cannot determine some steps due to missing coordination, list only the moves you can confidently execute.
moves.prompt: Your role is agent_3. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that respects the Tower of Hanoi rules and your permission to move disks H, I, J. Aim to contribute to the global goal {agents->agent_3->goal}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Receive the primitive move lists from agents agent_1, agent_2, and agent_3. Integrate and validate these moves to produce a single coherent plan. Output a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem tailored for the FastDownward solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions conceptually distinct when relevant and ensure the produced PDDL encodes the Tower of Hanoi rules, the agents' disk-move permissions as constraints or action preconditions, the initial state, and the target goal configuration.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Here is the public environment information: {environment->public_information}. Here are the three agents' private informations: {agents->agent_1->private_information}, {agents->agent_2->private_information}, {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Here are the move lists provided by the agents: {moves_agent_1}, {moves_agent_2}, {moves_agent_3}. Validate and integrate these primitive moves into a coherent plan that respects Tower of Hanoi rules and agent move restrictions. Then produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
